subject: Critical Thinking
title: How Fake News Spreads: The Anatomy of a Viral Lie
description: A 60-second lesson on How Fake News Spreads: The Anatomy of a Viral Lie.

hook.text: MIT study (2018): false news spreads 6x faster than true news on Twitter. Lies travel light. Truth is heavy.

buildup.text: False news succeeds because it's novel, emotional, and simple. True news is often complex, nuanced, and boring.

discovery.text: Vosoughi et al. found that false stories are 70% more likely to be retweeted than true ones.

twist.text: Corrections rarely catch up. By the time a fact-check is published, the false story has reached 10x more people.

climax.text: The sharing impulse is the vulnerability. Slow down, check the source, and resist the urge to be first to share.

punchline.text: A lie gets halfway around the world before the truth puts on its shoes.

quiz.question: Why does false news spread faster than true news?
options: It's more novel, emotional, and simpler than true news
